todaysEvents.title: Stealka Malware Targeting Gamers via Fake Mods
todaysEvents.description: Kaspersky researchers discovered 'Stealka' malware distributed as fake game mods on GitHub and SourceForge, targeting crypto wallets and browser credentials across 115 extensions.

todaysEvents.title: React2Shell RCE Exploited for Ransomware
todaysEvents.description: The React2Shell RCE vulnerability (CVE-2025-55182) affecting React Server Components is being exploited to deploy Weaxor ransomware.

todaysEvents.title: Critical n8n Code Execution Vulnerability
todaysEvents.description: A critical flaw in n8n has been identified that could enable arbitrary code execution.

todaysEvents.title: Browser-based e-Challan Phishing Campaign
todaysEvents.description: CRIL uncovered a new wave of browser-based e-Challan phishing powered by a shared fraud infrastructure.

todaysEvents.title: Baker University Major Data Breach
todaysEvents.description: Baker University disclosed a data breach affecting over 53,000 individuals, involving the theft of personal, health, and financial information after attackers accessed its network a year ago.

todaysEvents.title: US Justice Department Disrupts Fraud Infrastructure
todaysEvents.description: The U.S. Justice Department seized infrastructure used in a large-scale fraud operation that utilized fake search engine ads to harvest bank login credentials, resulting in at least $14.6 million in losses.

todaysEvents.title: WebRAT Malware Masquerading on GitHub
todaysEvents.description: WebRAT malware is being distributed via GitHub repositories that falsely claim to host proof-of-concept exploits for recently disclosed vulnerabilities.

todaysEvents.title: Indian Income Tax-themed Phishing Campaign
todaysEvents.description: An Indian Income Tax-themed phishing campaign targeting local businesses has been identified. Attackers use fake compliance notices to deploy malware and establish remote access.

todaysEvents.title: Nissan Customer Data Exposure via Red Hat Breach
todaysEvents.description: Nissan has confirmed the exposure of customer data following a breach at Red Hat.

past7Days.briefing: This week witnessed a sustained escalation in cyber threats, with multiple high-severity incidents impacting both enterprises and individuals across the globe. The most disruptive events included widespread exploitation of critical vulnerabilities in React Server Components (CVE-2025-55182), Fortinet products, and newly disclosed flaws in key platforms such as n8n, iMessage, and Dropbear. The financial sector was heavily targeted, highlighted by a $50 million USDT address-poisoning scam and significant breaches at Ribbon Finance and Yearn Finance. Ransomware and infostealer campaigns (e.g., Clop at University of Phoenix, Stealka malware, RatOn NFC fraud) demonstrated increasing sophistication and reach, while coordinated phishing and fraud operations affected government, education, and manufacturing sectors. Notably, law enforcement made impactful interventions against large-scale fraud, but the overall threat landscape remains volatile, with cybercriminals exploiting both technical and social attack vectors.
past7Days.trends: Key trends include a surge in exploits targeting web application frameworks (React, n8n), persistent weaponization of zero-day vulnerabilities, and rapid deployment of ransomware following initial access. Scams and credential theft—especially via address poisoning in crypto and phishing campaigns—are at all-time highs, with major losses reported. Malware distribution is increasingly leveraging trusted platforms such as GitHub and game mods, broadening the reach to non-traditional targets like gamers and university staff. Data breaches affecting millions (700Credit, University of Phoenix, Baker University, French Ministry of the Interior) indicate an uptick in attacks on large data repositories. Sectors seeing increased targeting include government, manufacturing, finance, and education, with multi-stage campaigns mixing technical exploits and social engineering.
past7Days.predictions: In the upcoming days, expect continued active exploitation of recently disclosed vulnerabilities (React2Shell, n8n, Dropbear, iMessage), likely resulting in further ransomware and data breach incidents. The crypto sector remains highly vulnerable to sophisticated scams and wallet-draining malware, with high confidence in ongoing address-poisoning and phishing attacks. New infostealers and RATs (e.g., Stealka, RatOn) are likely to proliferate via fake mods and pirated software, targeting both individuals and organizations. Large-scale data breaches and credential theft will continue, particularly targeting sectors with high-value data (finance, education, government). Organizations should prioritize immediate patching, multi-factor authentication, and user awareness programs. Confidence level: High for technical exploit/ransomware activity, Medium-High for social engineering and financial fraud campaigns.
